description:
Each decision we make in life leads us down a different path. Have you ever wondered what would be if the path not chosen weren't lost to the chaos of the universe? For Jun Sakurada, just such an opportunity is presented to him in his darkest hour: a chance to communicate with a future version of himself who did not win the key and bring forth the Rozen Maidens, and a chance to fix the shattered remains of his own world.

For Jun-who-did-not-win, the messages from his younger self represent a beacon of light in his mediocre and disappointing existence. When the adult Jun discovers a box with parts and building instructions for a familiar red-dressed doll, the goal becomes clear: revive Shinku in his world to save both worlds from succumbing to the evils of Kirakisho, the seventh Rozen Maiden in a desperate search for a body and master. The Alice Game will become a war of dimensions as two worlds hang by the threads of fate.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

title.native: ローゼンメイデン ~ トロイメント

node.description: Shinichi Omata is a Japanese director, storyboard artist, and former producer best known for directing Showa Genroku Rakugo Shinju (2016) and Kaguya-sama: Love is War (2019).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fusatora2828) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mangetsuhakase)

While attending Waseda University, Mochizuki became interested in animation and he joined the Waseda University Animation Association. In 1981, he began working for Ajia-do Animation Works. Mochizuki made his debut one year later when he acted as production director of the 1982 series Tokimeki Tonight. He went on to direct several of the magical girl series, including Magical Angel Creamy Mami. In 1986, he moved up to chief director with Hikari no Densetsu.

Mochizuki became known from the early 1990s as director of Ranma ½, Kimagure Orange Road and the Studio Ghibli TV movie Ocean Waves, he is also known for having directed Twin Spica, Zettai Shounen, the acclaimed World Masterpiece Theater series Porphy no Nagai Tabi. More recently he directed the noitaminA series House of Five Leaves in 2010 and Battery in 2016.

He currently divides his time between directing, writing scripts and acting as a series coordinator for various shows.

Married to [Masako Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/153654/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.
Junichirou Tanaka is a producer working for TBS.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fusatora2828) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mangetsuhakase)

He currently divides his time between directing, writing scripts and acting as a series coordinator for various shows.

Married to [Masako Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/153654/).

[Website](http://mitsumune.jp/)

Shinkichi Mitsumune is a Japanese composer who writes music primarily for anime. He graduated from Rikkyo University, College of Economics. From the young age of four, he attended the Yamaha Music School and received acoustic training. He started playing the electronic organ at the age of 10 and received tuition from Koichi Oki - a jazz organist while still in junior high school. While at university, he started playing the keyboard for professional bands following which he joined the band of jazz vocalist, Marlene, and toured various jazz festivals across Japan for about two years.

In 1995, he worked on his first anime soundtrack, [Nurse Angel Ririka SOS](https://anilist.co/anime/616/Nurse-Angel-Ririka-SOS/) in which the profound, high-quality and soothing composition performed with a full orchestra garnered high acclaim. This performance was followed by a string of hit anime soundtracks including [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/), [Yu-Gi-Oh!](https://anilist.co/anime/481/YuGiOh/), The series [Rozen Maiden](https://anilist.co/anime/64/Rozen-Maiden/), [Negima!](https://anilist.co/anime/157/Negima/) (2005), The Series [Zero no Tsukaima](https://anilist.co/anime/1195/The-Familiar-of-Zero/) and [Yu-Gi-Oh! VRAINS](https://anilist.co/anime/98231/YuGiOh-VRAINS/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.

Rie Matsubara does editing.

**Spouse:** [Shouichi Taguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/112059) (December 31, 2018-)

**[Website](http://annabel.jp/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/A_nnabel)** | **[Tumblr](https://annabel-annabel.tumblr.com/)** | **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/a_nnabel318/)**

**Introduction:**
Annabel is a Japanese-Argentine singer-songwriter signed under the company Lantis. In regards to her personal life, most of her information was unknown, until she revealed her real name via a letter to a famous radio station. Her real given name was revealed to be the same as her artist name, which is Annabel.

**Biography:**
She began her music career in 2005. In 2006, Annabel and singer [Nagi Yanagi (やなぎなぎ)](https://anilist.co/staff/109637/Nagi-Yanagi) formed the unit [Binaria](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3SkdXeqJHKFNXuaHvrj1pL?si=CZChqP69S3O6Dw0TBvdI_w), to date, they have released 13 albums. In 2007, she formed another unit with the singer Bermel.Inazawa called anNina. As anNina, the duo performed the ending themes to the second and third seasons of *[Higurashi: When They Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/934/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni/)*, respectively named *[Higurashi: When They Cry Kai](https://anilist.co/anime/1889/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni-Kai/)* and *[Higurashi: When They Cry Rei](https://anilist.co/anime/3652/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni-Rei/)*. In 2009, she started her solo career as a singer-songwriter, under the name Annabel.

Due to her rise in popularity, she started performing theme songs for the animation industry (anime series). Her first solo was "[Anamnesis](https://anidb.net/song/48723)", which was used as the ending theme to the 2012 anime TV series *[Another](https://anilist.co/anime/11111/Another)*, the single for "Anamnesis" was released on February 8, 2012. Annabel released her second single "[Above Your Hand](https://anidb.net/song/51660)" on May 23, 2012, which was used as the ending theme song for the anime TV series *[Sankarea](https://anilist.co/anime/11499/Sankarea)*. Her third single "[Signal Graph](https://anidb.net/song/52397)", was released on July 25, 2012, which was used as the opening theme for the anime TV series *[Love, Elections & Chocolate](https://anilist.co/anime/12175/Koi-to-Senkyo-to-Chocolate)*. She released her first solo album *[Miniascape](https://anidb.net/collection/8616)* on November 28, 2012.

In 2015, she sang the vocals for the theme song of the 3DS game, 7th Dragon III Code:VFD, from the 7th Dragon series.

In 2016, she formed the band siraph with Masayuki Hasuo and Masaaki Yamasaki (whom are former [School Food Punishment](https://anilist.co/staff/102508/School-Food-Punishment) members) and Yoshimasa Terui (from the band haisuinonasa) who were a member of her backup band.

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annabel_(Japanese_singer))
[Twitter](http://twitter.com/burikisan)

[Website](https://aliproject.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/alipro_yukyokai) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/allica_ism/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/AliProjectYukyokai) Introduction Ali Project (typeset as ALI PROJECT) is a Japanese band with a strong Japanese Aristocrat-style image, consisting of Arika Takarano and Mikiya Katakura. Biography In the band's earlier days, their musical style tended towards light, cheerful and/or refreshing songs. However, the sound has changed in recent times to take on a darker and more mysterious tone. Takarano Arika, lead singer/lyricist, has termed this change as a transition from White Alice (白アリ) to Black Alice (黒アリ). Though there has been a general shift towards performing songs in the "Black Alice" phase, Ali Project has occasionally sung in the White Alice style as well. In 1988 they made their indie debut in the chartsas Ari (Ant) Project (蟻プロジェクト) with their album Fantastic Garden (幻想庭園 Gensou Teien). The album was later included in Tatsumi Takayuki's book Philosophy of Progressive Rock (プログレッシヴ・ロックの哲学), which led to the band being classified under the progressive rock genre. Four years later in 1992 they changed their name and made their major debut with their single "Fall in love, maiden" (恋せよ乙女 Koi-seyo otome). Most of their records are released by Toshiba-EMI, Victor Entertainment and Tokuma Japan. The band is notable in the anime community for having their songs featured in several anime opening and ending sequences, most notably the series Noir and Rozen Maiden. Members - [Arika Takarano](https://anilist.co/staff/101307/Arika-Takarano) (宝野アリカ) - vocals, lyrics - [Mikiya Katakura](https://anilist.co/staff/101309/Mikiya-Katakura) (片倉三起也) - music, arrangement (Source: Wikipedia)

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), where he studied under [Ashida Toyoo](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/).

He made his debut as in-betweener on [Manga Nihon Emaki](https://anilist.co/anime/9856/) and became a key animator on [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/) but it was his work as animation director on the [Minky Momo](https://anilist.co/anime/518/) series that brought him recognition and he was asked to draw illustrations of Momo. Subsequently he became the character designer for the later OVAs.

In 1986 he made his debut as director on [Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver](https://anilist.co/anime/2293/). Following some more work as animator he switched to directing in the beginning of the '90s. He is nowadays affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).
__Mikiya Katakura__ is the keyboardist, composer and arranger of the duo [ALI PROJECT](https://anilist.co/staff/100631).
[Twitter](http://twitter.com/burikisan)
Arika Takarano is a singer and takes part in the music project [ALI PROJECT](https://anilist.co/staff/100631/ALI-PROJECT).
Shinichi Omata is a Japanese director, storyboard artist, and former producer best known for directing Showa Genroku Rakugo Shinju (2016) and Kaguya-sama: Love is War (2019).

**Spouse:** [Shouichi Taguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/112059) (December 31, 2018-)
